title: What if Winston Churchill was alive today? - Quora
tags: Politicians and Government Leaders of the United Kingdom

response.answer_text: He would be unimpressed with modern Britain because: his statue was vandalised - hard not to take that personallySome people think he was racist. By today’s standards he was. He was against Indian independence because he thought Indians were incapable of governing themselves. He hated Ghandi who is revered not just in India, but by many in the world.He’d be shocked at the amount of Indians living in Britain and serving in senior government portfolios.the British Empire is no more. He was a big believer and defender of the Empire because of the dominance and status it brought Britain. Fact was Britain couldn’t defend it during the war; couldn’t afford to administer it afterwards; and most people it colonised wanted Britain out, as the the mother country failed to defend them, exploited and infantilised them. Most Brits had no experience of the Empire nor were that interested in it, beyond the status it gave the UK as a world power.Britain is still not the global power (it was not when he died), but he’d be disappointed it never reclaimed that position.As an staunch anti Communist, he’d be joyous about the collapse of the USSR and the Eastern Block.He’d be horrified at China’s rapid development into an economic and military superpower (because China is Communist and Asian - he couldn’t fathom that a non Western and communist country could achieve this global status).He’d be dismayed that staff would complain about his inappropriate behaviour or expectations - drinking on the job, holding meetings while he was still in bed, throwing temper tantrums, staff being on call at all hours (those bloody socialist industrial agreements!) or expecting his secretary to take dictation while he bathed (albeit outside the door). Can’t do that now, even if you were PM.Contempt for smoking laws and all the “nonsense” about passive smoking - Illegal now to smoke the trademark cigar inside number 10, in the car or anywhere else that is enclosed or X metres from a building entry. What to do??So Churchill would be dismayed and in conflict with global development, modern laws and values, particularly around equality of races, multi culturalism, anti discrimination, self determination, universal suffrage and global support of decolonisation, etc.
He would be very old. He would also have campaigned to stay in the EU. He would be self isolating for Covid and fighting to make mask wearing compulsory.
